abstract: Allen Ying, a photographer, looks to recapture the late-'90s skate monthly with 43 Magazine.
snippet: Allen Ying, a photographer, looks to recapture the late-'90s skate monthly with 43 Magazine.
lead_paragraph: 43 Magazine, a new, independent bimonthly skateboard title was introduced on Thursday night at the Recess gallery in SoHo. Founded by Allen Ying, a longtime skate enthusiast and photographer, the magazine fixes to recapture some of the energy of the skate mags that Ying used to feverishly consume growing up in White Plains. "Nothing I've seen recently is as inspirational as what I used to read," Ying said, citing late-'90s monthlies like Transworld Skateboarding. "I wanted to create that."
